abstract: New Jersey releases results of harder tests that are based on Common Core standards; less than half of students from third through 11th grades score as proficient on math tests; rate is similar for English tests, although seventh and eight grades had passing rate of 52 percent.
lead_paragraph: The results from the 2014-2015 school year show that there is “still much work to be done,” the state education commissioner said.

headline.main: Test Scores Decline as New Jersey Aligns Exams With Common Core
headline.print_headline: Test Scores Fall as New Jersey Uses Harder Exams

snippet: The results from the 2014-2015 school year show that there is “still much work to be done,” the state education commissioner said.

keywords.value: Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (Parcc)
keywords.name: organizations
